description: From Latin coniugiālis, from coniugium (“connection, marriage”).

entries.meaning: Alternative form of conjugal used by Swedenborg and his followers, used to distinguish their ideas about marital relations.
examples: Claiming that he had ‘new information from heaven’, Swedenborg revealed that pre-marital sex with prostitutes or a mistress is not sinful, as long as the man maintains a belief in true conjugial love.
